text: Can it be right to give what I can give? To let thee sit beneath the fall of tears
To let thee sit beneath the fall of tears%% As salt as mine, and hear the sighing years
As salt as mine, and hear the sighing years%% Re-sighing on my lips renunciative
Re-sighing on my lips renunciative%% Through those infrequent smiles which fail to live
Through those infrequent smiles which fail to live%% For all thy adjurations? O my fears,
For all thy adjurations? O my fears, That this can scarce be right! We are not peers,
That this can scarce be right! We are not peers, So to be lovers; and I own, and grieve,
So to be lovers; and I own, and grieve, That givers of such gifts as mine are, must
That givers of such gifts as mine are, must%% Be counted with the ungenerous. Out, alas!
Be counted with the ungenerous. Out, alas! I will not soil thy purple with my dust,
I will not soil thy purple with my dust, Nor breathe my poison on thy Venice-glass,
Nor breathe my poison on thy Venice-glass, Nor give thee any love—which were unjust.
Nor give thee any love—which were unjust. Beloved, I only love thee! let it pass.
